intro: Racinaea tetrantha var. tetrantha, commonly known as the four-branch racinaea, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence known as a spadix, enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant features a rhizomatous root system and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are pollinated by insects. Its foliage consists of broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
